meanings.sent1: The classroom became unquieter when the students started chatting loudly.
meanings.sent2: The party grew unquieter as more guests arrived and the music got louder.
meanings.sent3: The library was unquieter than usual, with people whispering and shuffling books around.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside grew unquieter, with the wind howling and rain pounding on the windows.
meanings.sent5: The city streets were unquieter at night, with cars honking and people talking loudly.

meanings.sent1: The new soundproof curtains made the room unquieter by blocking out noise from outside.
meanings.sent2: The soft music playing in the background made the atmosphere unquieter and more relaxing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring made the room unquieter, creating a soothing ambiance.
meanings.sent4: The noise-canceling headphones made the airplane cabin unquieter, drowning out the engine sounds.
meanings.sent5: The thick carpet made the footsteps unquieter, muffling the sound as people walked.

meanings.sent1: The unquieter crowd at the concert cheered loudly as the band took the stage.
meanings.sent2: The unquieter engine of the truck roared as it accelerated down the highway.
meanings.sent3: The unquieter alarm clock beeped incessantly, waking up the heavy sleeper.
meanings.sent4: The unquieter wind howled through the trees, creating an eerie sound in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The unquieter fireworks lit up the night sky with loud pops and crackles.
